intro: Pavetta sumbawensis var. glabrescens, commonly known as the Sumbawa pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the island of Sumbawa in Indonesia and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. This variant is distinguished by its reduced pubescence compared to the typical form of Pavetta sumbawensis.
